intro: Arytera foveolata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Arytera foveolata is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
